comments: Log(base 2)7. Exponent in how, by recursive application of Strassen's algorithm, as shown in Nayebi, the product of two matrices can be computed by at most (4.7)*n^(log2(7)). Proof that this constant is irrational; by kb: Assume that log_2(7) = m/n for some positive integers m and n.==> 7 = 2^(m/n)==> 7^n = 2^m.This is a contradiction, because the left side is odd, while the right side is even. - _Jonathan Vos Post_, Feb 16 2011
